text: Which of the following is not a reason for attack?
note: Unpatched web server can leave your system vulnerable to attack.

text: What is the best countermeasure that can be used to safeguard backup files created by the web server?

answers.text: Backup in the same web directory

note: The best countermeasure is not to store sensitive files in the same directory of the web server.

text: Pick the server that doesn’t belong with the others.
note: IIS is a commercial web server developed by Microsoft for use with the Windows NT family.

text: Which is the most famous and easy to use password cracking tools?
note: Brutus is one of the fastest, most flexible, and free remote password crackers.

text: ________ makes sure that if a user is executing an action it is the same user who provided the credentials.
note: It makes sure that if a user is executing an action it is the same user who provided the credentials.

text: XSS, or cross-site scripting, cannot be in the form of:
note: XSS can be in the form of JavaScript, VBScript, ActiveX, HTML, or Flash.

text: In a(n) ______, the website permits the reuse of an old session cookie.
note: In insufficient session expiration, the website permits to reuse old session cookie or session ID to authorize new session.

text: Apache is a free, open source software, while IIS is commercial.
note: Apache and IIS are the two dominant web servers. Apache is open source while IIS is commercial.

text: A user lock-down mechanism can be used to protect the users from password cracking attacks while filling out the authentication web form.
note: Each website that presents an authentication web form might be targeted with a password cracking attack. A user lock-down mechanism can be used to defend the attack.

text: Only commercial web servers are available.
note: Both open source and commercial web servers are available. Apache is open source, while IIS is commercial.

text: Apache and IIS are commercial web servers.
note: Apache is open source while IIS is a commercial web server. You need to license the server OS and not the IIS directly.

text: IIS is used by a majority of websites.
note: Approximately 90 million websites use Apache while about 20 million use IIS.

text: If you are on Linux, the simple command "wget" with parameter -m will mirror the site.
note: On Linux you can use the simple command "wget" with parameter -m to mirror the site.

text: HTTrack is a perfect tool for mirroring.
note: HTTrack and BlackWidow are both perfect tools for mirroring a website.

text: Session hijacking exploits a weakness in the application development.
note: Session hijacking, or session management, exploits a weakness in the application development.

text: A weakness in the session management layer allows the hacker to bypass your security mechanism and control the session.
note: A weakness in the session management layer could allow the hacker to bypass your security mechanism and gain control of the session.

text: A proper access control list is used to defend hackers from navigating outside the web server directory.
note: A proper access control list is used to defend the hackers from navigating outside the web server directory. The directory traversal vulnerability allows the hacker to access the contents outside the web server directory and execute the applications in another directory.

text: Leaving the web server with default permissions will not give the hacker permissions to access all directories in the case of a successful attack.
note: Leaving the web server with default permissions will give the hacker permissions to navigate and access all directories on that host in the case of a successful attack.

text: The hacker makes use of social engineering to accomplish a CSRF attack.
note: CSRF is a form of cross-site scripting, where the hacker uses social engineering to accomplish an attack.

text: In XPath injection, the hacker can use the weak validation input to execute a script on the server.
note: LDAP injection, SQL injection, and XPath injection are some examples of attacks where the hacker can use the weak validation input to execute a script on the server.

text: _____ provides Internet security services.
note: It provides Internet security services and testing as well as help in analyzing many aspects of the Internet.

text: Web mirroring does the following except:
note: It is caused by misconfigured permissions that enable the attackers to access the directory.

text: Which of the following is not related to web servers vulnerabilities?
note: Hackers use tools to launch a dictionary attack against publicly available services. Most of the time, an application requires the user to provide credentials only once, at login, and this session lasts until it times out or the user logs out.

text: Which of the following doesn’t belong to the rest?
note: Session hijacking, or session management, exploits a weakness in the application development. The session management’s role is to make sure that if a user is executing an action, it is the same user who provided the credentials.

text: By creating resource mapping, you can enable the serving of backup files.
note: By creating resource mapping, you can disable the serving of backup files.

text: Nginx provides online tools to combat phishing on the Internet.
THC Hydra is a powerful network password cracker.
note: THC Hydra and Brutus are two powerful and flexible password cracker tools.

text: Authentication targets the area where a website gives the necessary permissions to perform certain actions, like accessing sensitive information or specific functionality.
note: Authorization targets the area where a website gives the necessary permissions to perform certain actions, like accessing sensitive information or specific functionality.

text: In CSRF the hacker exploits the trust that a user has for a website, while in XSS the hacker exploits the trust a website has for a user.
note: In XSS the hacker exploits the trust a user has for a website while in CSRF the hacker exploits the trust a website has for a user.
